title: "ShaderSearch: A Tool for Searching and Playing Shadertoy Shaders"
content:
ShaderSearch is a powerful search tool that allows you to search for and play Shadertoy shaders using shadertoy.com's API. This tool is an HTML file that is written in HTML, JavaScript, and CSS programming languages. It is an excellent example of how these programming languages can be used to develop powerful tools for developers.

Originally published on GitHub by mrmcsoftware, ShaderSearch is a free and open-source project that is available for anyone to use. This tool is designed to make it easy for developers to search for and play Shadertoy shaders. Shadertoy is a website that allows developers to create and share their own shaders. Shaders are programs that run on the graphics card and are used to create visual effects in video games, movies, and other applications.

ShaderSearch is a great tool for developers who are looking for a way to quickly find and test Shadertoy shaders. With this tool, you can search for shaders by keyword, author, or tag. You can also sort the results by popularity, date, or name. Once you have found a shader that you like, you can play it directly in your browser. You can also edit the shader code and see the changes in real-time.

One of the great things about ShaderSearch is that it is written in HTML, JavaScript, and CSS programming languages. These are the three core technologies used to develop websites and web applications. By using these languages, ShaderSearch is able to run directly in your web browser without the need for any additional software or plugins.

You can study the code and see how these languages are used to create a powerful search tool. You can also use ShaderSearch as a starting point for your own projects.

To use ShaderSearch, simply download the HTML file from GitHub and open it in your web browser. You can then start searching for Shadertoy shaders and playing them directly in your browser. If you want to make changes to the code, you can do so using any text editor.
